<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// optimistically assumes that all instructions are dead until proven otherwise,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// allowing it to eliminate dead computations that other DCE passes do not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00676" /><CodeLine lineNumber="676"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that it is incomplete in the presence of infinite loops but we don&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="737"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="738"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Therefore we preserve MemorySSA when only removing debug instructions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="739"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// since otherwise later passes may behave differently which then makes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00740" /><CodeLine lineNumber="740"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the presence of debug info affect code generation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
